title: Remove `Self: Type` bounds in Encode / Decode implementations
body:
Notes on the first commit:

* This changes a few `panic!`s behaviors. I'm assuming not using a format string there was an oversight, rather than those panics really being meant to be catch-able as `std::io::Error`s.
* It looks like `enter_runtime` for tokio was actually wrong before, due to the runtime guard being dropped before calling the function argument.

About the second ("main") commit: I've only tested that the change of the slice implementation doesn't result in compilation errors, nothing more.

title: test(sqlite): extend it_caches_statements() test
body:
Test that initial PRAGMA statements and &str statements are not
cached, but sqlx::query() statements are cached by default.

title: fix(sqlite): do not ignore API misuse errors from sqlite3_finalize
fix(sqlite): do not cast pointers to i32
body:
64-bit pointers can't be casted to i32 correctly.

It does not seem to cause problems on amd64 as long as both pointers
reside in the same page, but it's not correct generally.

title: fix(sqlite): reset the statement when fetch_many() stream is dropped
body:
Unlike `Executor.fetch_optional()`, `Executor.fetch_many()` does not
have a single exit.  The stream can be dropped at any time.  To catch
this event, we create a `StatementResetter` structure inside the stream
loop and reset the statement when it is dropped.

A test case `it_resets_prepared_statement_after_fetch_many` is
similar to `it_resets_prepared_statement_after_fetch_one` which tests
`Executor.fetch_optional()`.

Fixes #1147

title: Remove redunant braces in type_name
fix: pool internals improvements
body:
* fix `DecrementSizeGuard::drop()` only waking one `Waiter` regardless of whether that waiter was already woken
* fix connect-backoff loop giving up the size guard
* don't cut in line to open a new connection
* have tasks waiting on `acquire()` wake periodically to check if there's a connection in the queue

@dignifiedquire do you mind testing this?

Signed-off-by: Austin Bonander <austin@launchbadge.com>

title: Correct Postgres' Length Limit for Bind Parameters
Fix `sqlx-cli` crate link
body:
The link was broken since it used a singular "crate" in the URL.
Fix it by using "crates".

title: Bounds on `Connection::transaction` are overly strict
body: The provided callback doesn't seem to need to be `'static`. It seems to be enough that it doesn't borrow anything from the `Connection` itself, even if it does borrow data from elsewhere.

title: next branch cleanup
sqlx-cli database reset fix confirmation flag
body:
sqlx database reset currenctly requires no confirmation and a
confirmation when -y flag is set. Should be the other way around
as it is for sqlx database drop. This commit fixes this.

title: fix(postgres): Add support for domain types description
body:
Fix commit updates the `postgres::connection::describe` module to add full support for domain types. Domain types were previously confused with their category which caused invalid oid resolution.

Fixes ~~#110~~ launchbadge/sqlx#1110

title: Unlisten before releasing connections to the pool
body:
Fixes #612 
Includes changes from #1099 as they are a prerequisite.

title: Fix bug when a read on a BufStream is cancelled.
replace deprecated compare_and_swap() with compare_exchange()
body:
AtomicU32::compare_and_swap() is marked deprecated, in favor of compare_exchange().
compare_exchange() is fallible, so we continue to loop if it fails.
According to the docs, for the original AcqRel ordering, the equivalent failure ordering is Acquire.
https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/atomic/struct.AtomicU32.html#method.compare_exchange_weak

title: Fix for #935:  Removed unnecessarey preserve_order feature for serde_json in sqlx-cli
body:
* Removed unnecessarey preserve_order feature for serde_json
* More reliable serialization-desetislization of sqlx-data.json
* Added unit tests for sqlx-data.json serialization-deserialization

title: Support the sqlite locking_mode and auto_vacuum pragmas
body:
This adds enums for the possible values of those two pragmas, and sets
them at connection time.

My primary motivation for this is that to get the full benefits of
locking_mode, it needs to be set *before* setting journal_mode.

title: fix(migrations): rewrite the migration algorithm in order to apply also unapplied migrations
body:
Hi all,

Closes https://github.com/launchbadge/sqlx/issues/869
The main idea:
- retrieve the list of applied migrations from db
- check that each applied migration has a corresponding migration file (if it's not, raise an error about the missing migration)
- iterate over `Migrator` and check if a migration is already applied ( = check if the version of a migration is in the list of applied migrations):
   - if it's so, check checksums
   - if it's not, apply the migration (for `reverse` option, the migration is reversed only if it's version is not in the list of applied migrations).

Also I added the option `--ignore-missing` in cli in order to ignore missing applied migrations. The reason for this is because I have a project with multiple rust services connected to the same db and hence all migrations from these services are written into `_sqlx_migrations`. I thought to add a parameter specifying the migration table name, but I haven't figured out how best to pass the customized name to `Migrator` (maybe I'll create another PR for that)

I tested migrations (applying and reversing) against PostgreSQL, MySql and Sqlite. Of course, it's better to add some integration tests for that, but I haven't figured out yet how to do that.

title: add support for pgpass files
body:
This pr implements support for [pgpass files](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/libpq-pgpass.html)

Closes #1009
